contentrichtext.text: '''David''' or '''Dave''' or '''Dai Evans''' may refer to: {{tocright}} == Academics== * [[David A. Evans]] (born 1941), organic chemistry professor at Harvard University * [[David Evans (Yale professor)]] (born 1970), professor of geology and geophysics at Yale University * [[David Andreoff Evans]] (born 1948), computational linguist, entrepreneur * [[David C. Evans]] (1924–1998), American computer graphics pioneer * [[David Evans (mathematician)]] (born 1940), professor of applied mathematics at University of Bristol * [[David E. Evans]], professor of mathematics at Cardiff University * [[David Evans (musicologist)]], ethnomusicologist at the University of Memphis * [[David Evans (microbiologist)]] (1909–1984), British microbiologist * [[David S. Evans]], economist and lecturer at University College London and the University of Chicago Law School * [[David Stanley Evans]] (1916–2004), British astronomer * Sir David [[Emrys Evans]] (1891/2–1966), Welsh classicist and university principal * [[Dai Morgan Evans]] (born 1944), British archaeologist and academic == Artists == === Musicians === * [[David Evans (composer)]] (1874–1948), Welsh composer * [[Dave Evans (singer)]] (born 1953), first lead singer of the rock band AC/DC * David Howell Evans (born 1961), guitarist of Irish rock band U2, better known as [[The Edge]] === Other arts === * [[David Allan Evans]] (born 1940), American poet * [[David Evans (sculptor)]] (1893–1959), English sculptor born in Manchester * [[David M. Evans]] (born 1962), American movie director, producer, writer and actor * [[David Evans (director)]], director of ''[[Fever Pitch (1997 film)|Fever Pitch]]'' and various TV shows ==Politicians== * [[David Evans (British politician)]] (1935–2008), British businessman and Conservative politician, MP 1987–1997 * [[David Evans (MP for Cardiff)]] (died 1568), MP for [[Cardiff (UK Parliament constituency)|Cardiff]] * [[David Ellicott Evans]] (1788–1850), U.S. Representative from New York, 1827 * [[David H. Evans]] (1837–1920), New York politician * [[David R. Evans (South Carolina politician)]] (1769–1843), U.S. Representative from South Carolina * [[David W. Evans]] (born 1946), U.S. Representative from Indiana, 1975–1983 == Religion == * [[David Evans (Canon at St Asaph)]] (1705–1788), Welsh clergyman and writer * [[David Evans (Archdeacon of St Asaph)]] (died 1910), Welsh priest * [[David F. Evans]] (born 1951), American leader in The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints ==Sportsmen== * [[David Evans (athlete)]] (born 1967), Australian Paralympian * [[David Evans (cricketer, born 1869)]] (1869–1907), 22 first-class matches between 1889 and 1902 * [[David Evans (Somerset cricketer, born 1928)]] (1928–1991), eight first-class matches in 1953 * [[David Evans (umpire)]] (1933–1990), cricketer with Glamorgan and Test match umpire * [[David Evans (Hertfordshire cricketer)]] (1935–2008), List A cricketer with Hertfordshire, is the same as David Evans (British politician), above * [[Dai Evans (footballer)]] (1902–1951), Welsh international footballer * [[Dave Evans (footballer)]] (born 1958), former soccer player/footballer * [[David Evans (footballer)]] (born 1967), former soccer player/footballer with Chester City * David Evans, one of the three falsely accused Duke Lacrosse players (see [[2006 Duke University lacrosse case]]) * [[Dave Evans (racing driver)]] (1898–1974), American racecar driver * Sir [[David William Evans]] (1866–1926), Welsh lawyer, public servant and rugby international * [[Dai Evans]] (1872–1912), Wales international rugby union player * [[David Evans (rugby)]] (1886–1940), rugby union and rugby league footballer of the 1900s and '10s, for New Zealand (RU), Hawkes Bay, Napier RFC, and New Zealand (RL) * [[David Evans (rugby player)]] (born 1988), Welsh Sevens and Neath RFC * [[David Morgan Evans]] (1911–1941), Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer * [[David Evans (squash player)]] (born 1974), Welsh professional squash player ==Other professions== * Sir [[David Evans (RAF officer)]] (born 1924), Air Chief Marshal/Senior Commander in the Royal Air Force * [[David Morier Evans]] (1819–1874), financial journalist * [[Dave Evans (reporter)]] (born 1962), American reporter with WABC-TV * [[David Evans, Baron Evans of Watford]] (born 1942), British trade unionist and businessman * Sir [[David William Evans]] (1866–1926), Welsh lawyer, public servant and rugby international * [[David Evans (RAAF officer)]] (born 1925), retired senior officer of the Royal Australian Air Force * [[David Evans (administrator)]] (born 1960), American relief organisation officer * David Evans, worked for the [[Australian Greenhouse Office]] {{hndis|Evans, David}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Evans, David}}
